intro: Cephalaria armena, commonly known as Armenian cephalaria, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its showy yellow to orange flower heads appear in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Cephalaria armena is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to temperate to cold climates.
